definition: Structured, teacher-led approach with explicit teaching of concepts through clear explanations and guided practice

positive_examples: I will demonstrate the procedure step by step, then you practice while I observe.
The teacher explicitly modeled the problem-solving strategy before students tried it.
First I explain, then we do it together, then you try independently.
Clear, systematic instruction with immediate corrective feedback.
negative_examples: Students explored the materials freely without guidance.
The class discussed what they thought might happen before testing.
Learners discovered the principle through trial and error.
training_hints.disambiguation: Explicit teacher-led instruction, not discovery learning
